data.scheme_name: National SC-ST Hub  - Interventions to enhance competitiveness of SC-ST MSEs - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides various reimbursements on Bank Loan Processing Fee, Bank charges for Performance Bank Guarantee, membership /subscription/entry fee of Export Promotion Council, etc.
data.eligibility: All units engaged in the manufacturing and service activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Applicant must have SC/ST Certificate. 
  2. Eligible claim(s) with reference date of each quarter to reach by end of next quarter.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in the manufacturing and service activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Applicant must have SC/ST Certificate. 
  2. Eligible claim(s) with reference date of each quarter to reach by end of next quarter.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to encourage SC/ST owned units.
data.objective: To increase the share of purchases from the small-scale sector.
data.description:
1. Performance Bank Guarantee Charges: Reimbursement of 80% or Rs. 1 lakh (excluding GST and taxes), whichever is less, for PBG charges paid in a financial year. 
  2. Processing Fees: Reimbursement of 80% or Rs. 1 lakh (excluding GST and taxes), whichever is less, for processing fees charged by the bank. 
  3. Course Fees: Reimbursement of Rs. 1 lakh or 90% of course fees (whichever is less) per financial year. 
  4. EPC Membership Fee: Reimbursement of 80% or Rs. 0.20 lakh (excluding GST and taxes), whichever is less, for annual EPC membership fee. 
  5. Membership Renewals: Reimbursement of 80% or Rs. 0.25 lakh (excluding taxes), whichever is less, per financial year for new or renewal membership. 
  6. NSIC Registration: 100% reimbursement for obtaining NSIC registration under the Single Point Registration Scheme (SPRS). 
  7. Testing Fees: Reimbursement of 80% or Rs. 1 lakh (excluding GST and taxes), whichever is less, for testing fees per financial year.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant shall have to apply either online on website www.nsicspronline.com or on the prescribed application form in Duplicate and to be submitted to the concerned Zonal/Branch Office of NSIC or NSSH Office located nearest to the unit.
data.funding_mechanism: The approved amount would be reimbursed through the PFMS portal in the bank account of applicant units for which application is to be submitted in the prescribed format.
data.additional_info: Any SC-ST MSE availing reimbursement under all the above-mentioned components cannot avail reimbursement, from any other scheme of government or private agencies.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Self-certified copy of URC and GSTIN 
2. Self-certified copy of PAN card                                                                                                                                                          
3. Copy of Caste Certificate of proprietor/all partners/directors                                
4. Details of shareholding in case of partnership/ Private Limited/LLP firm 
5. Bank attested debit statement with PBG charges mentioning Bank Guarantee number and applicant MSEs name 
6. Bank attested and stamped copy of PBG issued by the Bank 
7. Cancelled cheque of the current account of the enterprise from which Bank charges have been debited 
8. Proof of transferred amount as reimbursement by National SC-ST Hub Office/National Small Industries Corporation.                                                                                                         
9. Supply Order/ Purchase Order/ Work Order from CPSE/ Central Government Organisation/ Department/ State PSE.                                                                                            
10. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
11. Other KYC Documents
data.checklist_info_d:

data.beneficiary: Manufacturing and Service Industry  - Proprietorship, Partnership, Private Limited Company, Public Company, Co-Operative societies - All Location  - Micro and Small
